titleStmt.title: Sir Iohn Hothams resolution presented to the King's most excellent majesty, at Beverley in the county of Yorkshire, on Tuesday the 12. of Iuly, 1642. Wherein is manifested his earnest desire both to expresse himselfe a loyall subject to His Majesty, and a faithfull servant to the Parliament. VVhereunto is annexed joyfull newes from Newcastle. Wherein is declared how the colliers resisted the Earle of Newcastle, and the cavaleeres, pul'd downe the fort which the said Earle had built, and beat him and his followers out of the county. Ordered that this be printed, and published. John Browne, Cler. Parl.
titleStmt.author: Hotham, John, Sir, d. 1645 Jan. 2.
England and Wales. Parliament.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
